alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 7:23PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Clay, central Randolph and Quitman Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 722 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Richland to near Lakepoint Resort State Park to near Pickett. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Days Crossroads, Springvale Station, Wire Bridge, Bonapartes Retreat, Standleys Store, Watson Crossroads, Peterson Hill, Coles, White House, Moores Crossroads, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Garnersville, Bagby State Park, Hatcher, Morris, Brooksville and Benevolence. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
